17  package org.springframework.core.env;

19  import java.lang.reflect.Field;

39  /**
40   * Unit tests for {@link StandardEnvironment}.
41   *
42   * @author Chris Beams
43   */
44  public class StandardEnvironmentTests {
45  
46  	private static final String ALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME = "theanswer";
47  	private static final String ALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE = "42";
48  
49  	private static final String DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME = "verboten";
50  	private static final String DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE = "secret";
51  
52  	private static final String STRING_PROPERTY_NAME = "stringPropName";
53  	private static final String STRING_PROPERTY_VALUE = "stringPropValue";
54  	private static final Object NON_STRING_PROPERTY_NAME = new Object();
55  	private static final Object NON_STRING_PROPERTY_VALUE = new Object();
56  
57  	private ConfigurableEnvironment environment = new StandardEnvironment();
58  
59  	@Test
60  	public void merge() {
61  		ConfigurableEnvironment child = new StandardEnvironment();
62  		child.setActiveProfiles("c1", "c2");
63  		child.getPropertySources().addLast(
64  				new MockPropertySource("childMock")
65  					.withProperty("childKey", "childVal")
66  					.withProperty("bothKey", "childBothVal"));
67  
68  		ConfigurableEnvironment parent = new StandardEnvironment();
69  		parent.setActiveProfiles("p1", "p2");
70  		parent.getPropertySources().addLast(
71  				new MockPropertySource("parentMock")
72  					.withProperty("parentKey", "parentVal")
73  					.withProperty("bothKey", "parentBothVal"));
74  
75  		assertThat(child.getProperty("childKey"), is("childVal"));
76  		assertThat(child.getProperty("parentKey"), nullValue());
77  		assertThat(child.getProperty("bothKey"), is("childBothVal"));
78  
79  		assertThat(parent.getProperty("childKey"), nullValue());
80  		assertThat(parent.getProperty("parentKey"), is("parentVal"));
81  		assertThat(parent.getProperty("bothKey"), is("parentBothVal"));
82  
83  		assertThat(child.getActiveProfiles(), equalTo(new String[]{"c1","c2"}));
84  		assertThat(parent.getActiveProfiles(), equalTo(new String[]{"p1","p2"}));
85  
86  		child.merge(parent);
87  
88  		assertThat(child.getProperty("childKey"), is("childVal"));
89  		assertThat(child.getProperty("parentKey"), is("parentVal"));
90  		assertThat(child.getProperty("bothKey"), is("childBothVal"));
91  
92  		assertThat(parent.getProperty("childKey"), nullValue());
93  		assertThat(parent.getProperty("parentKey"), is("parentVal"));
94  		assertThat(parent.getProperty("bothKey"), is("parentBothVal"));
95  
96  		assertThat(child.getActiveProfiles(), equalTo(new String[]{"c1","c2","p1","p2"}));
97  		assertThat(parent.getActiveProfiles(), equalTo(new String[]{"p1","p2"}));
98  	}
99  
100 	@Test
101 	public void propertySourceOrder() {
102 		ConfigurableEnvironment env = new StandardEnvironment();
103 		MutablePropertySources sources = env.getPropertySources();
104 		assertThat(sources.precedenceOf(PropertySource.named(StandardEnvironment.SYSTEM_PROPERTIES_PROPERTY_SOURCE_NAME)), equalTo(0));
105 		assertThat(sources.precedenceOf(PropertySource.named(StandardEnvironment.SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PROPERTY_SOURCE_NAME)), equalTo(1));
106 		assertThat(sources.size(), is(2));
107 	}
108 
109 	@Test
110 	public void propertySourceTypes() {
111 		ConfigurableEnvironment env = new StandardEnvironment();
112 		MutablePropertySources sources = env.getPropertySources();
113 		assertThat(sources.get(StandardEnvironment.SYSTEM_ENVIRONMENT_PROPERTY_SOURCE_NAME), instanceOf(SystemEnvironmentPropertySource.class));
114 	}

123 		assertThat(environment.getDefaultProfiles().length, is(1));

125 	}

127 	@Test
128 	public void setActiveProfiles() {
129 		environment.setActiveProfiles("local", "embedded");
130 		String[] activeProfiles = environment.getActiveProfiles();
131 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(activeProfiles), hasItems("local", "embedded"));
132 		assertThat(activeProfiles.length, is(2));
133 	}

165 	@Test
166 	public void addActiveProfile() {
167 		assertThat(environment.getActiveProfiles().length, is(0));
168 		environment.setActiveProfiles("local", "embedded");
169 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getActiveProfiles()), hasItems("local", "embedded"));
170 		assertThat(environment.getActiveProfiles().length, is(2));
171 		environment.addActiveProfile("p1");
172 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getActiveProfiles()), hasItems("p1"));
173 		assertThat(environment.getActiveProfiles().length, is(3));
174 		environment.addActiveProfile("p2");
175 		environment.addActiveProfile("p3");
176 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getActiveProfiles()), hasItems("p2", "p3"));
177 		assertThat(environment.getActiveProfiles().length, is(5));
178 	}
179 
180 	@Test
181 	public void reservedDefaultProfile() {
182 		assertThat(environment.getDefaultProfiles(), equalTo(new String[]{RESERVED_DEFAULT_PROFILE_NAME}));
183 		System.setProperty(DEFAULT_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME, "d0");
184 		assertThat(environment.getDefaultProfiles(), equalTo(new String[]{"d0"}));
185 		environment.setDefaultProfiles("d1", "d2");
186 		assertThat(environment.getDefaultProfiles(), equalTo(new String[]{"d1","d2"}));
187 		System.getProperties().remove(DEFAULT_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME);
188 	}

190 	@Test
191 	public void getActiveProfiles_systemPropertiesEmpty() {
192 		assertThat(environment.getActiveProfiles().length, is(0));
193 		System.setProperty(ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME, "");
194 		assertThat(environment.getActiveProfiles().length, is(0));
195 		System.getProperties().remove(ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME);
196 	}

198 	@Test
199 	public void getActiveProfiles_fromSystemProperties() {
200 		System.setProperty(ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME, "foo");
201 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getActiveProfiles()), hasItem("foo"));
202 		System.getProperties().remove(ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME);
203 	}

205 	@Test
206 	public void getActiveProfiles_fromSystemProperties_withMultipleProfiles() {
207 		System.setProperty(ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME, "foo,bar");
208 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getActiveProfiles()), hasItems("foo", "bar"));

214 		System.setProperty(ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME, " bar , baz "); // notice whitespace
215 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getActiveProfiles()), hasItems("bar", "baz"));
216 		System.getProperties().remove(ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME);

219 	@Test
220 	public void getDefaultProfiles() {
221 		assertThat(environment.getDefaultProfiles(), equalTo(new String[] {RESERVED_DEFAULT_PROFILE_NAME}));
222 		environment.getPropertySources().addFirst(new MockPropertySource().withProperty(DEFAULT_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME, "pd1"));
223 		assertThat(environment.getDefaultProfiles().length, is(1));
224 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getDefaultProfiles()), hasItem("pd1"));
225 	}
226 
227 	@Test
228 	public void setDefaultProfiles() {
229 		environment.setDefaultProfiles();
230 		assertThat(environment.getDefaultProfiles().length, is(0));
231 		environment.setDefaultProfiles("pd1");
232 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getDefaultProfiles()), hasItem("pd1"));
233 		environment.setDefaultProfiles("pd2", "pd3");
234 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getDefaultProfiles()), not(hasItem("pd1")));
235 		assertThat(Arrays.asList(environment.getDefaultProfiles()), hasItems("pd2", "pd3"));
236 	}

259 	@Test
260 	public void acceptsProfiles_activeProfileSetProgrammatically() {
261 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("p1", "p2"), is(false));
262 		environment.setActiveProfiles("p1");
263 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("p1", "p2"), is(true));
264 		environment.setActiveProfiles("p2");
265 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("p1", "p2"), is(true));
266 		environment.setActiveProfiles("p1", "p2");
267 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("p1", "p2"), is(true));
268 	}
269 
270 	@Test
271 	public void acceptsProfiles_activeProfileSetViaProperty() {
272 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("p1"), is(false));
273 		environment.getPropertySources().addFirst(new MockPropertySource().withProperty(ACTIVE_PROFILES_PROPERTY_NAME, "p1"));
274 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("p1"), is(true));
275 	}
276 
277 	@Test
278 	public void acceptsProfiles_defaultProfile() {
279 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("pd"), is(false));
280 		environment.setDefaultProfiles("pd");
281 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("pd"), is(true));
282 		environment.setActiveProfiles("p1");
283 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("pd"), is(false));
284 		assertThat(environment.acceptsProfiles("p1"), is(true));
285 	}

287 	@Test
288 	public void environmentSubclass_withCustomProfileValidation() {
289 		ConfigurableEnvironment env = new AbstractEnvironment() {
290 			@Override
291 			protected void validateProfile(String profile) {
292 				super.validateProfile(profile);
293 				if (profile.contains("-")) {
294 					throw new IllegalArgumentException(
295 							"Invalid profile [" + profile + "]: must not contain dash character");
296 				}
297 			}
298 		};
299 
300 		env.addActiveProfile("validProfile"); // succeeds
301 
302 		try {
303 			env.addActiveProfile("invalid-profile");
304 			fail("expected validation exception");
305 		} catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
306 			assertThat(ex.getMessage(),
307 					equalTo("Invalid profile [invalid-profile]: must not contain dash character"));
308 		}
309 	}
310 
311 	@Test
312 	public void getSystemProperties_withAndWithoutSecurityManager() {
313 		System.setProperty(ALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME, ALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE);
314 		System.setProperty(DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME, DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE);
315 		System.getProperties().put(STRING_PROPERTY_NAME, NON_STRING_PROPERTY_VALUE);
316 		System.getProperties().put(NON_STRING_PROPERTY_NAME, STRING_PROPERTY_VALUE);
317 
318 		{
319 			Map<?, ?> systemProperties = environment.getSystemProperties();
320 			assertThat(systemProperties, notNullValue());
321 			assertSame(systemProperties, System.getProperties());
322 			assertThat(systemProperties.get(ALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME), equalTo((Object)ALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE));
323 			assertThat(systemProperties.get(DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME), equalTo((Object)DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE));
324 
325 			// non-string keys and values work fine... until the security manager is introduced below
326 			assertThat(systemProperties.get(STRING_PROPERTY_NAME), equalTo(NON_STRING_PROPERTY_VALUE));
327 			assertThat(systemProperties.get(NON_STRING_PROPERTY_NAME), equalTo((Object)STRING_PROPERTY_VALUE));
328 		}
329 
330 		SecurityManager oldSecurityManager = System.getSecurityManager();
331 		SecurityManager securityManager = new SecurityManager() {
332 			@Override
333 			public void checkPropertiesAccess() {
334 				// see http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#getProperties()
335 				throw new AccessControlException("Accessing the system properties is disallowed");
336 			}
337 			@Override
338 			public void checkPropertyAccess(String key) {
339 				// see http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#getProperty(java.lang.String)
340 				if (DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME.equals(key)) {
341 					throw new AccessControlException(
342 							format("Accessing the system property [%s] is disallowed", DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME));
343 				}
344 			}
345 			@Override
346 			public void checkPermission(Permission perm) {
347 				// allow everything else
348 			}
349 		};
350 		System.setSecurityManager(securityManager);
351 
352 		{
353 			Map<?, ?> systemProperties = environment.getSystemProperties();
354 			assertThat(systemProperties, notNullValue());
355 			assertThat(systemProperties, instanceOf(ReadOnlySystemAttributesMap.class));
356 			assertThat((String)systemProperties.get(ALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME), equalTo(ALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE));
357 			assertThat(systemProperties.get(DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME), equalTo(null));
358 
359 			// nothing we can do here in terms of warning the user that there was
360 			// actually a (non-string) value available. By this point, we only
361 			// have access to calling System.getProperty(), which itself returns null
362 			// if the value is non-string.  So we're stuck with returning a potentially
363 			// misleading null.
364 			assertThat(systemProperties.get(STRING_PROPERTY_NAME), nullValue());
365 
366 			// in the case of a non-string *key*, however, we can do better.  Alert
367 			// the user that under these very special conditions (non-object key +
368 			// SecurityManager that disallows access to system properties), they
369 			// cannot do what they're attempting.
370 			try {
371 				systemProperties.get(NON_STRING_PROPERTY_NAME);
372 				fail("Expected IllegalArgumentException when searching with non-string key against ReadOnlySystemAttributesMap");
373 			} catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
374 				// expected
375 			}
376 		}
377 
378 		System.setSecurityManager(oldSecurityManager);
379 		System.clearProperty(ALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME);
380 		System.clearProperty(DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME);
381 		System.getProperties().remove(STRING_PROPERTY_NAME);
382 		System.getProperties().remove(NON_STRING_PROPERTY_NAME);
383 	}
384 
385 	@Test
386 	public void getSystemEnvironment_withAndWithoutSecurityManager() {
387 		getModifiableSystemEnvironment().put(ALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME, ALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE);
388 		getModifiableSystemEnvironment().put(DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME, DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE);
389 
390 		{
391 			Map<String, Object> systemEnvironment = environment.getSystemEnvironment();
392 			assertThat(systemEnvironment, notNullValue());
393 			assertSame(systemEnvironment, System.getenv());
394 		}
395 
396 		SecurityManager oldSecurityManager = System.getSecurityManager();
397 		SecurityManager securityManager = new SecurityManager() {
398 			@Override
399 			public void checkPermission(Permission perm) {
400 				//see http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#getenv()
401 				if ("getenv.*".equals(perm.getName())) {
402 					throw new AccessControlException("Accessing the system environment is disallowed");
403 				}
404 				//see http://download.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/System.html#getenv(java.lang.String)
405 				if (("getenv."+DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME).equals(perm.getName())) {
406 					throw new AccessControlException(
407 							format("Accessing the system environment variable [%s] is disallowed", DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME));
408 				}
409 			}
410 		};
411 		System.setSecurityManager(securityManager);
412 
413 		{
414 			Map<String, Object> systemEnvironment = environment.getSystemEnvironment();
415 			assertThat(systemEnvironment, notNullValue());
416 			assertThat(systemEnvironment, instanceOf(ReadOnlySystemAttributesMap.class));
417 			assertThat(systemEnvironment.get(ALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME), equalTo((Object)ALLOWED_PROPERTY_VALUE));
418 			assertThat(systemEnvironment.get(DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME), nullValue());
419 		}
420 
421 		System.setSecurityManager(oldSecurityManager);
422 		getModifiableSystemEnvironment().remove(ALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME);
423 		getModifiableSystemEnvironment().remove(DISALLOWED_PROPERTY_NAME);
424 	}
425 
426 	@SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
427 	private static Map<String, String> getModifiableSystemEnvironment() {
428 		// for os x / linux
429 		Class<?>[] classes = Collections.class.getDeclaredClasses();
430 		Map<String, String> env = System.getenv();
431 		for (Class<?> cl : classes) {
432 			if ("java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableMap".equals(cl.getName())) {
433 				try {
434 					Field field = cl.getDeclaredField("m");
435 					field.setAccessible(true);
436 					Object obj = field.get(env);
437 					if (obj != null && obj.getClass().getName().equals("java.lang.ProcessEnvironment$StringEnvironment")) {
438 						return (Map<String, String>) obj;
439 					}
440 				} catch (Exception ex) {
441 					throw new RuntimeException(ex);
442 				}
443 			}
444 		}
445 
446 		// for windows
447 		Class<?> processEnvironmentClass;
448 		try {
449 			processEnvironmentClass = Class.forName("java.lang.ProcessEnvironment");
450 		} catch (Exception e) {
451 			throw new RuntimeException(e);
452 		}
453 
454 		try {
455 			Field theCaseInsensitiveEnvironmentField = processEnvironmentClass.getDeclaredField("theCaseInsensitiveEnvironment");
456 			theCaseInsensitiveEnvironmentField.setAccessible(true);
457 			Object obj = theCaseInsensitiveEnvironmentField.get(null);
458 			return (Map<String, String>) obj;
459 		} catch (NoSuchFieldException e) {
460 			// do nothing
461 		} catch (Exception e) {
462 			throw new RuntimeException(e);
463 		}
464 
465 		try {
466 			Field theEnvironmentField = processEnvironmentClass.getDeclaredField("theEnvironment");
467 			theEnvironmentField.setAccessible(true);
468 			Object obj = theEnvironmentField.get(null);
469 			return (Map<String, String>) obj;
470 		} catch (NoSuchFieldException e) {
471 			// do nothing
472 		} catch (Exception e) {
473 			throw new RuntimeException(e);
474 		}
475 
476 		throw new IllegalStateException();
477 	}
